byline.original: By BENJAMIN WEISER and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

abstract: Drug Enforcement Admin employees David Polos and Glen Glover are charged with making false statements after their ownership stakes are disclosed in New Jersey strip club called Twins Plus Go-Go Lounge; Polos, an official at the DEA in New York City, had retired from agency after career of more than 20 years; both men face up to five years in prison.
lead_paragraph: A senior official and a senior employee at the Drug Enforcement Administration have been charged with making false statements about outside employment on a background check.

headline.main: 2 D.E.A. Workers Are Accused of Secretly Running Strip Club
headline.print_headline: 2 D.E.A. Workers Accused of Secretly Running Strip Club

snippet: A senior official and a senior employee at the Drug Enforcement Administration have been charged with making false statements about outside employment on a background check.

keywords.value: Twins Plus Go-Go Lounge (South Hackensack, NJ, Strip Club)
